8PDF-file metadata: Privacy Filtering all metadataAdrian Daerradaerr04/23/14
column2: 09:23:03 PM"This pull-request pertains to the addition of metadata to PDF files associated with entries
column3: as triggered by the menu entry ""Write XMP metadata to PDFs"" in the ""Tools"" menu. XMP is an extremely interesting feature that allows tagging PDF files (amongst others) with automatically retrievable metadata in much the same way mp3-tags allow adding title/author/... information to mp3 music files. Actually JabRef exports the metadata not only to two XMP namespaces (Dublin Core and a custom JabRef namespace)
column4: but also to the PDF DocumentInformation Object.

column1: Practically from the beginning of the XMP-writing capabilities of JabRef
column2: Christopher Oezbek had added _privacy filtering_ for the XMP-tagging of PDF-files with data from the bibtex-record
column3: meaning that the user could define a list of fields (in Preferences->XMP metadata) which should _not_ be exported to the PDF file.  Unfortunately
column4: the filtering was incomplete: jabref exports the metadata in three different forms
column5: only one of which was originally filtered. In 2013 filtering was extended to both XMP namespaces
column6: but JabRef still exported _all_ fields into the PDF DocumentInfo object. The two present commits correct this problem. The first (b45316f) prevents private fields from being exported to the PDF DocumentInfo. The second one more agressively erases these fields even if they already exist in the PDF document.

column1: The deletion of existing fields might be debateable. It seems the right thing to do for fields clearly generated by JabRef (viz. those prefixed by ""jabref/"")
column2: but there are four fields which might be of other origin (Author
column3: Title
column4: Subject and Keywords). Making a systematic exception for these four fields
column5: i.e. not erasing them even if they are privacy filtered
column6: is a bad idea and violates the principle of least surprise. This is why the second commit makes no exception. Deactivating the erasure for the four generic fields could however easily be added as an option in the XMP export preferences if it is judged important. The current behaviour has the advantage of reliably correcting PDF files previously tagged with a buggy privacy filtering.

column1: If these commits are pulled into the master branch and confirmed to work
column2: the bug #869 on the sourceforge tracker:

column1: https://sourceforge.net/p/jabref/bugs/869/
can be closed.""thx!
=||= "PDF-file metadata: Privacy Filtering all metadataAdrian Daerradaerr04/23/14

column1: 10try to fix some obvious bugs about `groups`braindevices05/20/14
column2: 12:55:20 PM"Hi All

column1: I just upgraded to 2.10 and I found some bugs immediately.
1. in the right-click-menu there is no `move-to-group` but 2 `remove
from group` instead.
2. I like the new add/remove/move panel
column2: but the scrolling is not

column1: working
column2: which is a big problem. Because I have lots of groups which

column1: cannot even fit into the full screen height after expansion.
3. no way to expand or collapse all nodes
I tried the dev version
column2: all problems still exist. Here is my fixation.

column1: Cheers
W.L.""After 2.10 the BibtexEntryType.java is changed a lot. The optional fields and required fields are very different. If one need the field order is exactly the same as the 2.9.2
column2: one should manually define the order. 2.10 also fixes some bugs in entry sorting. Some entries will be always different from 2.9.2. So I think backward-compatibility does not make sense any more. If one really want the bib file arranged in the same way as 2.9.2
column3: he should just use 2.9.2. Upgrade all client to 2.10 makes more sense here.

column1: 11"BugFix for bug ""#880 PubMed Import broken"""vegeziel06/28/14
column2: 12:38:20 AM"Found bug: PubMed/Medline PLAIN format recognized as RIS format.

column1: Provided solution:
- Modified RIS ImportFilter. Now RIS format is identified by looking for the ""TY"" tag (it is a mandatory tag in RIS format and it is not conflictual with other filters)

- Added new ImportFilter ""MedlinePlain"". This import filter parses Medline files in plain format (not XML). The import filter has been produced referring to the official Medline documentation (http://www.nlm.nih.gov/bsd/mms/medlineelements.html)
- Updated the net.sf.jabref.core plugin.xml file in order to include the newly added MedlinePlain import filter"NaN"BugFix for bug ""#880 PubMed Import broken"""vegeziel06/28/14
column2: 12:38:20 AM"Found bug: PubMed/Medline PLAIN format recognized as RIS format.

column1: Provided solution:
- Modified RIS ImportFilter. Now RIS format is identified by looking for the ""TY"" tag (it is a mandatory tag in RIS format and it is not conflictual with other filters)

- Added new ImportFilter ""MedlinePlain"". This import filter parses Medline files in plain format (not XML). The import filter has been produced referring to the official Medline documentation (http://www.nlm.nih.gov/bsd/mms/medlineelements.html)
- Updated the net.sf.jabref.core plugin.xml file in order to include the newly added MedlinePlain import filter"NaNvegeziel06/27/14
column2: 06:53:49 PM"BugFix for ""#880 PubMed Import broken""

column1: Found bug: PubMed/Medline PLAIN format recognized as RIS format.
Provided solution:
- Modified RIS ImportFilter. Now RIS format is identified by looking for the ""TY"" tag (it is a mandatory tag in RIS format and it is not conflictual with other filters)

- Added new ImportFilter ""MedlinePlain"". This import filter parses Medline files in plain format (not XML). The import filter has been produced referring to the official Medline documentation (http://www.nlm.nih.gov/bsd/mms/medlineelements.html)
- Updated the net.sf.jabref.core plugin.xml file in order to include the newly added MedlinePlain import filter"1

column1: 18Fix edits getting lost in Biblatex modedahlheim09/08/14
column2: 11:54:53 AM"This fixes a bug where edits made in a field on a

column1: CompressedEntryEditorTab wouldn't get stored when the field editor lost
focus.
The bug was caused by EntryEditorTabFocusListener accessing the unused inherited parent field
of CompressedEntryEditorTab instances instead of the latter class's own (private) parent field.
Instead of doing just a quick fix
column2: I decided to eliminate the excessive code and data duplication

column1: in the two classes altogether and consolidate them into one class (with an additional flag to the constructor)

since I don't think an extra class is warranted here (and easily and sensibly implementable by derivation).""Thank you for the PR. Did you add yourself to About.html as described in [CONTRIBUTING.MD](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)?
=||= Yes
column2: I already did.

=||= Done.
=||= "Fix edits getting lost in Biblatex modedahlheim09/08/14

column1: 28Added special fields 'Printed' and 'Read status'Tobias Dieztobiasdiez10/28/14
column2: 06:19:46 PM"Added special fields 'Printed' and 'Read status'
column3: thereby implementing (at least partially):

column1: - Feature #762 Printed attribute
- Feature #692 Marking of new entries and often read entries
- Feature #685 Highlight new entries that were ""forgotten""
- Feature #602 could add the mark as read feature
- Feature #225 read? checkbox
Printed is just a boolean toggle and for the read field currently the values 'Skimmed' and 'Read' are possible (if you have any suggestions for further possibilities
column2: I'm happy to implement them). The icons are taken from http://www.softicons.com/system-icons/crystal-project-icons-by-everaldo-coelho and should probably be replaced with icons from the same collection as the other currently used ones.""This feature is availale on JabRef 2.10?

column1: What should I do to get them?

=||= No it is not in 2.10 but in the current development version. So you have to wait until 2.11 comes out or build the current version yourself. How to do the latter is described here: https://github.com/JabRef/jabref#building-jabref-from-source
=||= Thank you very much.
I'm could not install gradle on my laptop (ubuntu 14.04).
Looking forward to the 2.11 release.
=||= "Added special fields 'Printed' and 'Read status'Tobias Dieztobiasdiez10/28/14

- Feature #692 Marking of new entries and often read entries
- Feature #685 Highlight new entries that were ""forgotten""
- Feature #602 could add the mark as read feature
- Feature #225 read? checkbox
Printed is just a boolean toggle and for the read field currently the values 'Skimmed' and 'Read' are possible (if you have any suggestions for further possibilities
column2: I'm happy to implement them). The icons are taken from http://www.softicons.com/system-icons/crystal-project-icons-by-everaldo-coelho and should probably be replaced with icons from the same collection as the other currently used ones."NaNTobias10/27/14

column1: 32Small bugfixes/improvements for biblatex supportTobias Dieztobiasdiez12/02/14
column2: 06:03:46 PM"Fixed bug where conversion of a bibtex year/month representation to the biblatex date field an invalid date would be generated (i.e. 2013-1 instead of 2013-01)

column1: Added basic formating of date fields in cleanup""Thank you for your patch.
The fix for the BibtexEntry can be accepted immediately.
However
column2: JabRef is currently targeting Java 7
column3: while you made use of classes from Java 8 in CleanUpAction. Hence
column4: this part of the pull request cannot be accepted at this point in time.

column1: Is it wise to include Joda time? Or should this be done with the old and antique class Calendar? @koppor
=||= I think a workaround with the old Calendar class is way more complicated since the day-part is optional and as much as I know about the old time classes such situations are hard to handle.
On the other hand
column2: I think the feature in CleanUpAction is not that important and useful for other users and could be skipped as long as Jabref targets Java 7 (it was morally a feature to repair the damage caused by the bug in BibtexEntry).

column1: =||= I split the commit and put it into the master branch with commit d0b4faf7.
=||= "NaNNaNNaNNaNNaNNaNNaNNaNNaN0

column1: 35Solve the bug '1248 Key bindings not modified'alauber05/13/15
column2: 12:55:07 PM"After checking the bug '1248 Key bindings not modified'
column3: it was Identified que the creation of the hashmap list 'defKeyBinds' that sets the standard keyboard shortcuts
column4: the feature 'Open folder' was not included in the 'defineDefaultKeyBindings ( )' method in 'JabRefPreferences' class .

column1: In the creation of the menu item in the 'JabRefFrame' class for the item 'Open folder'
column2: it was not possible to recover the value of the item in the list 'defKeyBinds'
column3: occurring error 'NullPointerException' in the 'String makeEscape (String s) 'method in 'JabRefPreferences' class
column4: which shouldnt return the value of 'String' to fill out the menu item.

column1: When the 'User' tried to change and save the list
column2: the error 'NullPointerException' not allow the execution of the procedure.

column1: To solve the bug
column2: was included in the verification of the presence of null in 'keyBinds' list (copy of 'defKeyBinds')
column3: the value 'Not associated' being passed to the 'String' return.

column1: The warning that menu feature is created in the 'JabRefFrame' class without associated keyboard shortcut
column2: was moved to the method mentioned before
column3: as was duplicated.""Thanks for the PR. Please add yourself to About.html as described in  [CONTRIBUTING.MD](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)

column1: =||= I would also prefer not to include the first two commits (8e46928 and 1e1ca6). Or are they interesting for guys working on the issue?

=||= "NaNNaNNaNNaNNaNNaNNaNNaNNaN0

column1: Ç ü é ã á ä à å ç ê ë è ï í ì î Ä Å É æ Æ ô ö ò û ù ÿ Ö Ü ó ú ñ Ñ Ã Á Â À Ð Ê Ë È Í Î Ï Ì Ó Ô Ò õ Õ Ú Û Ù ý Ý ø Ø ï""GitHub has the disadvantage that it continues updating the pull request when new commits flow into a branch. Therefore
column2: the ""Cleanup entries error 3"" commit went into this PR. Should be OK for now
column3: but for the next PRs
column4: please make a separate branch for each fix :)

column1: =||= About the commit

column1: =||= About the ""`A""
column2: in my environment I tested all the characters listed (Ç ü é ã á ä à å ç ê ë è ï í ì î Ä Å É æ Æ ô ö ò û ù ÿ Ö Ü ó ú ñ Ñ Ã Á Â À Ð Ê Ë È Í Î Ï Ì Ó Ô Ò õ Õ Ú Û Ù ý Ý ø Ø ï). Those who had problems I changed. (Print of a example attached before the change)

column1: ![jabref](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11490603/7329140/8c740f8a-eab2-11e4-9348-61c88c89779e.png)

My enviroment is a Archlinux with Java 1.8.0_45. I will try to find a Windows enviroment to test before send more commits in the future.
=||= The fix in HTMLConverter is incorrect for the accented i:s. With the modification the accent is added to a normal i
column2: while in the old version it was added to a dot-less i (\i).

column1: =||= I did not understand. Can you explain in more detail? I tested all ""i"" characters and seem correct to me.
=||= See
column2: e.g.
column3: https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/LaTeX/Special_Characters especially

column1: To place a diacritic on top of an i or a j
column2: its dot has to be removed. The dotless version of these letters is accomplished by typing \i and \j.""

column1: 40Fix for bug #876: Windows 7/8/10 - Pinning Jabref to the taskbarTobias Dieztobiasdiez05/11/15
column2: 04:15:52 PM"Previously
column3: JabRef couldn't be pinned to the taskbar ([bug report](https://sourceforge.net/p/jabref/bugs/876/)). The reason is that
column4: by wrapping JabRef with Launch4j
column5: Windows thinks only Java is running and does not recognize JabRef as something separate.

column1: Based on a [stackoverflow question](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9330209/whats-the-best-way-to-start-java-applications-on-windows-7) the fix proceeds in two stages:
- During the setup
column2: we create a (dummy) shortcut and set the [Application User Model Id](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd378459%28v=vs.85%29.aspx). For this
column3: we use the [WinShell plugin](http://nsis.sourceforge.net/WinShell_plug-in) for NSIS.

column1: - At program start
column2: we notify Windows that this JabRef instance has the AppUserModelId specified in the setup. In order to do this
column3: we invoke native commands using the Java Native Access (JNA) library. ""Thank you for the pull request. My issue is that it includes commits not being related with the fix. The typical way of creating pull requests is to have a separate branch for each pull request. So we can discuss each improvement separately.

column1: The comment is very useful. However
column2: it would be better to place it in the commit message to have it stored in the git repository
column3: too. We have an initial code documentation at https://sourceforge.net/p/jabref/wiki/Development_Howtos/
column4: but I think
column5: that is the wrong place for that.

column1: =||= I see your point! The other git commits just revert some local changes so that I'm in sync with your repository. All changes in ""Files changed"" are needed for this fix.
Since I'm new to git
column2: I would welcome if you could provide me tips how I can now remove the unnecessary commits and add the above description to the commit message. Thanks.

column1: =||= "NaNNaNNaNNaNNaNNaNNaNNaNNaN0
